title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 139.1 - Introduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 139.1 - Introduction

State Regulations

Section
1194
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law provides for the temporary suspension and
subsequent revocation of a license or operating privilege when a person refuses
to submit to a chemical test. Section
49-a
of the

Navigation Law provides for the temporary suspension and subsequent suspension
of the privilege of operating a vessel when a person refuses to submit to a
chemical test. Section
25.24
of the Parks, Recreation and

Historic Preservation Law contains a similar provision regarding refusing a
chemical test when operating a snowmobile. In order to facilitate the orderly
taking and recording of such actions, and to insure that hearings are held in
timely fashion, these regulations are promulgated pursuant to the authority
contained in section
1194
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law, section
25.24
of the Parks, Recreation and

Historic Preservation Law and section
49-a
of the

Navigation Law. Unless otherwise noted, commissioner
shall
refer to the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, and
department
shall refer to the Department of Motor Vehicles. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
139.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
